text:
Hi All,
I’m thinking about moving my blog primary domain to a subfolder of my landing page primary domain.
Has anyone here done this before, and if so are there any concerns?

My blog is currently on a subdomain blog.mydomain.example
I’d like to move it to a subdirectory of my landing page HubSpot domain - info.mydomain.example/blog.


*EDIT (additional info):*
I consume the blog data via the HubSpot API to my www subdomain which is a non-HubSpot site.
SEO impact isn’t a huge concern, however I will be adding in a wildcard  301 redirect rule:
 blog.mydomain.example/* -> www.mydomain.example/blog/*


Thanks
The main concern would be redirecting everything correctly to not lose SEO rankings

I should have added that I don’t publicly promote the blog subdomain.
I render the blog data via the HubSpot api to my www subdomain which is a non-HubSpot site.

My friend added the serverless function but We got stuck because of credential error.
I have read a lot of report on the community forum.
I asked my friend to refresh the access token but it does not work...

Can you help me check it, Carter?

Link: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1672818435785509>
In the case that your current blog domain isn’t indexed, then of course SEO concerns aren’t relevant.
Ok, wait.. let me get this straight
You want to change the blog domain of your site that currently pulls blog posts via the API, right?

Yes, from a site usage perspective the blog domain gets no traffic.
As for backend, I only use the HubSpot blog tools for content creation

I think you’d need to look into 301 redirecting any indexed posts from e.g.:

subdomain blog.mydomain.example/post-name-example

to

info.mydomain.example/blog/post-name-example

However you could do a google search on: site:blog.mydomain.example and see if the posts are indexed with your subdomain. If so you should indeed make sure to redirect the old urls to the updated ones when you’ve moved to <http://www.mydomain.example/blog/|www.mydomain.example/blog/>

I’ll be making a wildcard page redirect rule to cover any possible impact on google search

The wildcard redirect will also handle topics, authors and feed urls
I think the wildcard would suffice, as you described in the edit

Hello everyone,

Does anyone know if I can redirect where customer form information is stored? I am trying to store this data on a different
platform. I currently need this form to continue being a pop up on my HubSpot website but I'm not sure if I should
try to change where the data is being stored or if I can some how code it where HubSpot pops up an entirely different
form not made on HubSpot. Please give me some input on how you would approach this situation or ask me any questions
that will help you help me out better. Thank you!
Hi there, I'm interested in adding personalisation to an existing website (not HubSpot), based on segments managed in HubSpot. Is this possible? Which APIs should I be looking at?
